snippet: The victory by Mauricio Macri, 56, the mayor of Buenos Aires, revealed deep fissures in Argentina and was seen as an affront to the departing president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner.
abstract: Argentina elects former Buenos Aires mayor Mauricio Macri president after runoff against candidate aligned with incumbent, Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner; winner, who ran to right of Peronist establishment, inherits politically polarized country and tottering economy.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and JONATHAN GILBERT

lead_paragraph: The victory by Mauricio Macri, 56, the mayor of Buenos Aires, revealed deep fissures in Argentina and was seen as an affront to the departing president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner.

headline.main: In Rebuke to Kirchner, Argentines Elect Opposition Leader Mauricio Macri as President
headline.print_headline: In Rebuke to Kirchner, Argentines Elect Opposition Figure as President
